meanings.definition: Quick to take offense or to detect insult or injury; touchy.
meanings.sent1: She is very taky and gets upset easily.
meanings.sent2: He becomes taky whenever someone criticizes his work.
meanings.sent3: Even a small comment can make her feel taky.
meanings.sent4: His taky nature is like a fragile glass, easily shattered by words.
meanings.sent5: Her taky attitude makes it hard to have a calm conversation.

meanings.sent1: The noise from the construction site made him feel taky.
meanings.sent2: She gets taky when things don't go according to plan.
meanings.sent3: His taky reaction to the delay was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The constant buzzing of the fly was a taky reminder of his irritation.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy fabric of the shirt made her skin feel taky.

meanings.sent1: She is taky about any comments on her appearance.
meanings.sent2: He is taky when it comes to discussing his past mistakes.
meanings.sent3: His taky reaction to the joke was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The taky look on her face showed she was deeply offended.
meanings.sent5: The taky tone in his voice revealed his sensitivity.
